p: The chemical composition of Betonica officinalis includes polyphenols such as tannins, phenolic acids, flavonoids, alkaloids trigonelline, and stachydrine (a pyrrolidine alkaloid), iridoids, diterpenes, phenylethanoid glycosides, fatty acids, betaine, volatile oils, and choline [ 149, 150]. According to the literature data, phenylethanoid glycosides, triterpenoids, and flavonoids are considered to be the active components responsible for the biological actions of the genus Stachys, but the anti-inflammatory or analgesic effects, or components of it, have not been elucidated completely so far.
